channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Manitoba Government's Connected Approach Supporting Primary Care, Faster Discharges: CIHI Report
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Freeland exploring Canadian business opportunities to help rebuild Ukraine
item.description: The Privy Council Office said Freeland will advise the government on Ukraine's economic reconstruction and the effort to bring home thousands of abducted Ukrainian children.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Thousands fill Bell Centre demanding Quebec suspend law reforming doctors' pay
item.description: Thousands of doctors, medical students and supporters filled the Bell Centre on Sunday to demand the Quebec government suspend Bill 2. The law links a part of physicians' pay to performance indicators relating to, for example, the number of patients they care for or the number of surgeries performed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Japanese immigrants fought for Canada during WW I while denied the right to vote
item.description: For the first time the faces of Japanese Canadian veterans who fought in the First and Second World War are on display on the streets of Vancouver after a century largely unrecognized and their stories untold.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: MMA gym owners, coaches ID’d at secretive neo-Nazi event in B.C.
item.description: This summer in Vancouver, dozens of people gathered to attend a conference organized and attended by some of Canada’s most prominent white supremacist organizations. CBC’s visual investigations team looked into the event, obtaining images of people there from the Canadian Anti-Hate Network.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Man Who Tracks Silicon Valley’s ‘Nerd Reich’
item.description: Wonder what US tech titans wish for, Canada? Study their roots, says writer Gil Duran. A Tyee Q&A.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: A Tiny Town’s Successful Newspaper Faces a Succession Crisis
item.description: In the West Kootenays, a beloved local paper needs a new owner. Other small BC papers give reason for optimism.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Increased chance to catch aurora borealis over coming days, says Calgary photographer
item.description: Because of increased solar activity, the likelihood of seeing aurora borealis in Western Canada skies over the next few nights has increased, says a Calgary photographer.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: World Culinary Awards names Baan Lao best restaurant in Canada for the second straight year
item.description: The Richmond restaurant took home the honours once again.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Hosting Grey Cup in Winnipeg hailed as 'a major economic driver' by businesses, politicians
item.description: Members of Canada’s Armed Forces repelled from a helicopter Sunday afternoon at The Forks with precious cargo — the Grey Cup — to mark the beginning of Grey Cup week, which will culminate with the CFL championship game on Nov. 16 at Princess Auto Stadium in Winnipeg.

item.title: Stellantis takes Ontario auto supplier to court over claims of extortion
item.description: Stellantis and one of its Canadian auto suppliers are battling in court over the price of brake rotors in a dispute that threatens to shutter some auto assembly plants in Michigan.

item.title: B.C. residents encouraged by extortion fight, say more action needed
item.description: Some members of B.C.'s South Asian community are applauding action by the province's extortion task force on recent actions, but they say still more needs to be done.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: More than 10K people protest Quebec's physician payment law at Bell Centre
item.description: The protest took aim at Premier Francois Legault's legislation known as Bill 2, which changes how doctors in the province are paid.

item.title: You Nearly Missed: Ada Lea promises to inspire at LanaLou's in Vancouver
item.description: "Because anyone can, you can also do it."

item.title: First flu death of the season in Alberta amid warnings about potentially tough months ahead
item.description: Alberta has marked its first influenza death of this year's flu season, after last year's season proved the deadliest in more than a decade.
